TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit UriBuilder extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides a custom constructor for uniform resource identifiers (URIs) and modifies URIs for the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.UriBuilder> class provides a convenient way to modify the contents of a <xref:System.Uri> instance without creating a new <xref:System.Uri> instance for each modification.
The <xref:System.UriBuilder> properties provide read/write access to the read-only <xref:System.Uri> properties so that they can be modified.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The parameterless constructor creates a new instance of the <xref:System.UriBuilder> class with its properties initialized as follows.
|Property|Initial Value| |--------------|-------------------| |Fragment|<xref:System.String.Empty>| |Host|"loopback"| |Password|<xref:System.String.Empty>| |Path|"/"| |Port|-1| |Query|<xref:System.String.Empty>| |Scheme|"http"| |UserName|<xref:System.String.Empty>|

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string uri) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified URI.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor initializes a new instance of the <xref:System.UriBuilder> class with the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Fragment%2A>, <xref:System.UriBuilder.Host%2A>, <xref:System.UriBuilder.Path%2A>, <xref:System.UriBuilder.Port%2A>, <xref:System.UriBuilder.Query%2A>, <xref:System.UriBuilder.Scheme%2A>, and <xref:System.UriBuilder.Uri%2A> properties set as specified in `uri`.
If `uri` does not specify a scheme, the scheme defaults to "http:".

Docs.exception:

is a zero-length string or contains only spaces.
-or-
The parsing routine detected a scheme in an invalid form.
-or-
The parser detected more than two consecutive slashes in a URI that does not use the "file" scheme.
-or-
is not a valid URI.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor initializes a new instance of the <xref:System.UriBuilder> class with the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Fragment%2A>, <xref:System.UriBuilder.Host%2A>, <xref:System.UriBuilder.Path%2A>, <xref:System.UriBuilder.Port%2A>, <xref:System.UriBuilder.Query%2A>, <xref:System.UriBuilder.Scheme%2A>, and <xref:System.UriBuilder.Uri%2A> properties set as specified in `uri`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string schemeName, string hostName) cil managed
Public Sub New (schemeName As String, hostName As String)

Docs.param: A DNS-style domain name or IP address.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified scheme and host.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.UriBuilder> instance is initialized with the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Scheme%2A> property set to `schemeName` and the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Host%2A> property set to `hostName`. <xref:System.UriBuilder.Port%2A> is initialized to the value -1 to indicate the default port for the scheme should be used, and the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Path%2A> property is set to the slash character (/).
## Examples The following example creates a <xref:System.UriBuilder> instance that contains the URI `http://www.contoso.com/`.
[!code-cpp[Classic UriBuilder.UriBuilder3 Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic UriBuilder.UriBuilder3 Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic UriBuilder.UriBuilder3 Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic UriBuilder.UriBuilder3 Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic UriBuilder.UriBuilder3 Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic UriBuilder.UriBuilder3 Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public UriBuilder (string scheme, string host, int portNumber);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string scheme, string host, int32 portNumber) cil managed
Public Sub New (scheme As String, host As String, portNumber As Integer)
public: UriBuilder(System::String ^ scheme, System::String ^ host, int portNumber);
new UriBuilder : string * string * int -> UriBuilder

Docs.param: A DNS-style domain name or IP address.
An IP port number for the service.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified scheme, host, and port.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.UriBuilder> instance is initialized with the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Scheme%2A> property set to `schemeName`, the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Host%2A> property set to `hostName`, and the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Port%2A> property set to `portNumber`. The <xref:System.UriBuilder.Path%2A> property is set to the slash character (/).
If the `portNumber` is set to a value of -1, this indicates that the default port value for the `scheme` will be used to connect to the `host`.
## Examples The following example creates a <xref:System.UriBuilder> instance that contains the URI `http://www.contoso.com:8080/`.
[!code-cpp[Classic UriBuilder.UriBuilder4 Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic UriBuilder.UriBuilder4 Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic UriBuilder.UriBuilder4 Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic UriBuilder.UriBuilder4 Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic UriBuilder.UriBuilder4 Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic UriBuilder.UriBuilder4 Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

Docs.exception: is less than -1 or greater than 65,535.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.UriBuilder> instance is initialized with the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Scheme%2A> property set to `schemeName`, the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Host%2A> property set to `hostName`, the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Port%2A> property set to `portNumber` and the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Path%2A> property set to `pathValue`.
If the `portNumber` is set to a value of -1, this indicates that the default port value for the `scheme` will be used to connect to the `host`.

Public Sub New (scheme As String, host As String, port As Integer, path As String, extraValue As String)

new UriBuilder : string * string * int * string * string -> UriBuilder
MemberSignature.Usage: new System.UriBuilder (scheme, host, port, path, extraValue)

Docs.param: A DNS-style domain name or IP address.
An IP port number for the service.
The path to the Internet resource.
A query string or fragment identifier.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified scheme, host, port number, path and query string or fragment identifier.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.UriBuilder> instance is initialized with the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Scheme%2A> property set to `schemeName`, the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Host%2A> property set to `hostName`, the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Port%2A> property set to `portNumber`, and the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Path%2A> property is set to `pathValue`. If `extraValue` begins with a number sign (#), then <xref:System.UriBuilder.Fragment%2A> is set to `extraValue`. If `extraValue` begins with a question mark (?), then <xref:System.UriBuilder.Query%2A> is set to `extraValue`.
If the `portNumber` is set to a value of -1, this indicates that the default port value for the `scheme` will be used to connect to the `host`.
## Examples The following example creates a <xref:System.UriBuilder> instance that contains the URI `http://www.contoso.com:8080/index.htm#top`.
[!code-cpp[Classic UriBuilder.UriBuilder6 Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic UriBuilder.UriBuilder6 Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic UriBuilder.UriBuilder6 Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic UriBuilder.UriBuilder6 Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic UriBuilder.UriBuilder6 Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic UriBuilder.UriBuilder6 Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

Docs.exception: is neither nor , nor does a valid fragment identifier begin with a number sign (#), nor a valid query string begin with a question mark (?).
is less than -1 or greater than 65,535.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool Equals(object rparam) cil managed
Public Overrides Function Equals (rparam As Object) As Boolean

Docs.param: The object to compare with the current instance.
Docs.summary: Compares an existing instance with the contents of the for equality.
Docs.returns: if represents the same as the constructed by this instance; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.UriBuilder.Equals%2A> method compares a specified <xref:System.Uri> instance with the <xref:System.Uri> instance built by the <xref:System.UriBuilder> instance. If the two are the same, the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Equals%2A> method returns `true`.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Fragment { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Fragment : string with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the fragment portion of the URI.
Docs.value: The fragment portion of the URI. The fragment identifier ("#") is added to the beginning of the fragment.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.UriBuilder.Fragment%2A> property contains any text following a fragment marker (#) in the URI, including the marker itself. When setting the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Fragment%2A> property, the fragment marker is added to its value. **Note** In version 1.0 and 1.1 of the .NET Framework, setting the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Fragment%2A> property to any value, including `null`, cleared the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Query%2A> property, and setting the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Fragment%2A> property to `null` or to <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=nameWithType> cleared the property. In version 2.0, however, the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Fragment%2A> and <xref:System.UriBuilder.Query%2A> properties are independent.
**Note** Do not append a string directly to this property. If the length of <xref:System.UriBuilder.Fragment%2A> is greater than 1, retrieve the property value as a string, remove the leading pound sign, append the new query string, and set the property with the combined string.
## Examples The following example creates the URI `"http://www.contoso.com/index.htm#main"`.
[!code-cpp[Classic UriBuilder.Fragment Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic UriBuilder.Fragment Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic UriBuilder.Fragment Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic UriBuilder.Fragment Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic UriBuilder.Fragment Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic UriBuilder.Fragment Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance int32 GetHashCode() cil managed
Public Overrides Function GetHashCode () As Integer

Docs.summary: Returns the hash code for the URI.
Docs.returns: The hash code generated for the URI.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The hash code is generated without including any fragment. The URIs `http://www.contoso.com/index.htm#search` and `http://www.contoso.com/index.htm` generate the same hash code.
The hash codes for <xref:System.Uri> A and B are guaranteed to be the same when A.Equals(B) is `true`.
This method implements <xref:System.Object.GetHashCode%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>.

Docs.value: The DNS host name or IP address of the server.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.UriBuilder.Host%2A> property contains the fully qualified DNS host name or IP address of the server.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Path { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Path : string with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the path to the resource referenced by the URI.
Docs.value: The path to the resource referenced by the URI.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.UriBuilder.Path%2A> property contains the path information that the server uses to resolve requests for information. Typically this is the path to the desired information on the server's file system; although it also can indicate the application or script that the server must run to provide the information.
The path information does not include the scheme, host name, or query portion of the URI. The <xref:System.UriBuilder.Path%2A> property always returns at least a slash (/).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int Port { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.Port : int with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the port number of the URI.
Docs.value: The port number of the URI.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The port number defines the protocol port for contacting the host referenced in the URI. If a port is not specified as part of the URI, the <xref:System.Uri.Port%2A> property returns the value of -1 to indicate that the default port value for the protocol scheme will be used to connect to the host. If the <xref:System.Uri.Port%2A> property is set to a value of -1, this indicates that the default port value for the protocol scheme will be used to connect to the host.

Docs.exception: The port cannot be set to a value less than -1 or greater than 65,535.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Query { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Query : string with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets any query information included in the URI.
Docs.value: The query information included in the URI.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Uri.Query%2A> property contains any query information included in the URI. Query information is separated from the path information by a question mark (?) and continues to the end of the URI. The query information returned includes the leading question mark.
The query information is escaped according to RFC 2396.
**Note** In version 1.0 and 1.1 of the .NET Framework, setting the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Fragment%2A> property to any value, including `null`, cleared the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Query%2A> property, and setting the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Fragment%2A> property to `null` or to <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=nameWithType> cleared the property. In version 2.0, however, the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Fragment%2A> and <xref:System.UriBuilder.Query%2A> properties are independent.
**Note** Do not append a string directly to this property. If the length of <xref:System.UriBuilder.Query%2A> is greater than 1, retrieve the property value as a string, remove the leading question mark, append the new query string, and set the property with the combined string.
## Examples The following example sets the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Query%2A> property.
[!code-cpp[UriBuilderSample#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/UriBuilderSample/cpp/main.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[UriBuilderSample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/UriBuilderSample/cs/main.cs#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Scheme { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Scheme : string with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the scheme name of the URI.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following table lists the valid scheme names for the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Scheme%2A> property.
|Scheme|Description| |------------|-----------------| |file|The resource is a file on the local computer.| |ftp|The resource is accessed through FTP.| |gopher|The resource is accessed through the Gopher protocol.| |http|The resource is accessed through HTTP.| |https|The resource is accessed through SSL-encrypted HTTP.| |mailto|The resource is an email address and is accessed through SMTP.| |news|The resource is accessed through NNTP.|

Docs.exception: The scheme cannot be set to an invalid scheme name.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString() cil managed
Public Overrides Function ToString () As String

Docs.summary: Returns the display string for the specified instance.
Docs.returns: The string that contains the unescaped display string of the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The display string contains the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Port%2A> property value if the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Port%2A> property was set or the port was specified when the <xref:System.UriBuilder> was constructed using of the <xref:System.UriBuilder.%23ctor%2A> methods that accept a port number parameter except for the case when the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Port%2A>.property value was set to a value of -1 to indicate the default port.
The display string does not contain the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Port%2A> property value if the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Port%2A> property was not set and a port was not specified when the <xref:System.UriBuilder> was constructed. The display string also does not contain the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Port%2A> property value if the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Port%2A> property or port number for the constructor was set to a value of -1.

Docs.exception:
In the .NET for Windows Store apps or the Portable Class Library, catch the base class exception, , instead.
The instance has a bad password.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.UriBuilder.Uri%2A> property contains the <xref:System.Uri> created by the <xref:System.UriBuilder>. Any changes made to the <xref:System.UriBuilder> properties are reflected in the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Uri%2A> property.

Docs.exception:
In the .NET for Windows Store apps or the Portable Class Library, catch the base class exception, , instead.
The URI constructed by the properties is invalid.
